modules.description: This module provides functions to define bidirectional data encodings using lenses, which unify serialization and deserialization logic. It supports basic types like integers (signed, unsigned, arbitrary precision), strings, and bytes, as well as composite types through pairing and sum types. Use cases include structured binary data encoding, protocol definition, and efficient buffer manipulation for network or storage formats.

This module facilitates bit-level serialization and deserialization through buffers, handling both raw bit sequences and structured data types like integers (fixed and variable-length), booleans, bytes, and strings. It supports dictionary-based compression to replace repeated strings with compact references, optimizing storage efficiency, and includes utilities for analyzing bit distribution in serialized data, making it suitable for compact binary encoding and high-performance data transmission scenarios.

This module defines metadata about the build version, including the version string, commit hash, and commit date. It works with string and option types to represent versioning information. Useful for embedding and retrieving build-time details in applications.

This module enables bidirectional bit-level serialization and deserialization of structured data using lenses, unifying encoding logic across integers, strings, bytes, booleans, and composite types. It supports efficient buffer manipulation, dictionary-based compression for repeated strings, and variable-length encoding to optimize storage and transmission. Specific use cases include defining binary protocols, compactly encoding data for network transfer or storage, and analyzing bit-level data distribution. Additionally, it provides build metadata handling for embedding version and commit information.
